et: Middle English {it}repulsyve{/it} {ldquo}(in medicine) dissipating collected humors,{rdquo} borrowed from Middle French & Medieval Latin; Middle French {it}repulsif{/it} {ldquo}repelling, dissipating humors,{rdquo} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}repulsīvus,{/it} from Latin {it}repulsus,{/it} past participle of {it}repellere{/it} {ldquo}to push away, drive back, fend off{rdquo} + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive} {ma}{mat|repel|}{/ma}
shortdef: tending to repel or reject : cold, forbidding
